abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan supports
            the Economic Transformation Program (ETP). The ETP has three
            objectives: stabilization, structural reform towards the
            establishment of a market economy to improve resource
            allocation and restore growth, and the progressive
            restoration of creditworthiness. The ETP represents a
            program combining stabilization and structural change,
            including a radical liberalization of the trade regime as
            well as pricing. The ETP also includes a medium-term
            macroeconomic framework and external financing strategy. The
            microeconomic core program comprises three main components:
            (a) enterprise restructuring, privatization, private sector
            development, with appropriate legislation to impose
            financial discipline and establish an adequate institutional
            framework for enterprise restructuring, including stricter
            environmental standards; (b) financial sector reform, with
            emphasis on improved banking regulation and supervision,
            introduction of adequate accounting and auditing standards,
            and strengthening and phase re-structuring of the banking
            system; and (c) social safety net, with emphasis on adequate
            unemployment benefits, employment services, training, a
            program of minimum social assistance, and improvement of
            health policy.
